intro: Lysimachia kochii, commonly known as the yellow loosestrife, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has oval, opposite leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Lysimachia kochii is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
